instructions.name: accept_split
docs:
* A split request can only be accepted by the `pda_authority` from
     * the config account. If accepted, `amount` tokens are transferred to a new stake account
     * owned by the `recipient` and the split request is reset (by setting `amount` to 0).
     * The recipient of a transfer can't vote during the epoch of the transfer.
     *
     * The `pda_authority` must explicitly approve both the amount of tokens and recipient, and
     * these parameters must match the request (in the `split_request` account).

accounts.name: source_custody_authority
docs: CHECK : This AccountInfo is safe because it's a checked PDA

accounts.name: new_custody_authority
docs: CHECK : This AccountInfo is safe because it's a checked PDA

instructions.name: create_position
docs: Creates a position
Looks for the first available place in the array, fails if array is full
Computes risk and fails if new positions exceed risk limit

instructions.name: create_stake_account
docs: Trustless instruction that creates a stake account for a user
The main account i.e. the position accounts needs to be initialized outside of the program
otherwise we run into stack limits

accounts.name: custody_authority
docs: CHECK : This AccountInfo is safe because it's a checked PDA

instructions.name: join_dao_llc
docs:
* Accept to join the DAO LLC
     * This must happen before create_position or update_voter_weight
     * The user signs a hash of the agreement and the program checks that the hash matches the
     * agreement

accounts.name: owner
docs: CHECK : This AccountInfo is safe because it's checked against stake_account_metadata

instructions.name: recover_account
docs:
Recovers a user's `stake account` ownership by transferring ownership
     * from a token account to the `owner` of that token account.
     *
     * This functionality addresses the scenario where a user mistakenly
     * created a stake account using their token account address as the owner.

instructions.name: request_split
docs:
* Any user of the staking program can request to split their account and
     * give a part of it to another user.
     * This is mostly useful to transfer unvested tokens. Each user can only have one active
     * request at a time.
     * In the first step, the user requests a split by specifying the `amount` of tokens
     * they want to give to the other user and the `recipient`'s pubkey.

accounts.name: publisher
docs: CHECK : This AccountInfo is just used to construct the target that will get slashed

accounts.name: custody_authority
docs: CHECK : This AccountInfo is safe because it's a checked PDA

accounts.name: custody_authority
docs: CHECK : This AccountInfo is safe because it's a checked PDA

errors.name: TooMuchExposureToIntegrityPool
errors.msg: Too much exposure to integrity pool

errors.name: CreatePositionWithZero
errors.msg: New position needs to have positive balance

errors.name: ClosePositionWithZero
errors.msg: Closing a position of 0 is not allowed

errors.name: AmountBiggerThanPosition
errors.msg: Amount to unlock bigger than position

errors.name: WithdrawToUnauthorizedAccount
errors.msg: Owner needs to own destination account

errors.name: InsufficientWithdrawableBalance
errors.msg: Insufficient balance to cover the withdrawal

errors.name: WrongTarget
errors.msg: Target in position doesn't match target in instruction data

errors.name: InvalidVotingEpoch
errors.msg: Voting epoch is either too old or hasn't started

errors.name: VoteDuringTransferEpoch
errors.msg: Can't vote during an account's transfer epoch

errors.name: NotLlcMember
errors.msg: You need to be an LLC member to perform this action

errors.name: SplitZeroTokens
errors.msg: Can't split 0 tokens from an account

errors.name: SplitTooManyTokens
errors.msg: Can't split more tokens than are in the account

errors.name: SplitWithStake
errors.msg: Can't split a token account with staking positions. Unstake your tokens first.

errors.name: InvalidApproval
errors.msg: The approval arguments do not match the split request.

errors.name: RecoverWithStake
errors.msg: Can't recover account with staking positions. Unstake your tokens first.

errors.name: InvalidPoolAuthority
errors.msg: The pool authority hasn't been passed or doesn't match the target

errors.name: InvalidSlashRatio
errors.msg: The slash ratio should be between 0 and 1

errors.name: UnexpectedTargetAccount
errors.msg: The target account is only expected when dealing with the governance target

fields.name: pyth_token_list_time
docs: Once the pyth token is listed, governance can update the config to set this value.
Once this value is set, vesting schedules that depend on the token list date can start
vesting.

types.name: MaxVoterWeightRecord
docs: Copied this struct from https://github.com/solana-labs/solana-program-library/blob/master/governance/addin-api/src/max_voter_weight.rs

fields.name: realm
docs: The Realm the MaxVoterWeightRecord belongs to

fields.name: governing_token_mint
docs: Governing Token Mint the MaxVoterWeightRecord is associated with
Note: The addin can take deposits of any tokens and is not restricted to the community or
council tokens only

fields.name: max_voter_weight
docs: Max voter weight
The max voter weight provided by the addin for the given realm and governing_token_mint

fields.name: max_voter_weight_expiry
docs: The slot when the max voting weight expires
It should be set to None if the weight never expires
If the max vote weight decays with time, for example for time locked based weights, then
the expiry must be set As a pattern Revise instruction to update the max weight should
be invoked before governance instruction within the same transaction and the expiry set
to the current slot to provide up to date weight

fields.name: reserved
docs: Reserved space for future versions

types.name: Position
docs: This represents a staking position, i.e. an amount that someone has staked to a particular
target. This is one of the core pieces of our staking design, and stores all
of the state related to a position The voting position is a position where the
target_with_parameters is VOTING

types.name: PositionData
docs: The header of DynamicPositionArray

types.name: StakeAccountMetadataV2
docs: This is the metadata account for each staker
It is derived from the positions account with seeds "stake_metadata" and the positions account
pubkey It stores some PDA bumps, the owner of the account and the vesting schedule

types.name: TargetMetadata
docs: This represents a target that users can stake to
Currently we store the last time the target account was updated, the current locked balance
and the amount by which the locked balance will change in the next epoch

types.name: VestingSchedule
docs: Represents how a given initial balance vests over time
It is unit-less, but units must be consistent

types.name: VoterWeightAction
docs: The governance action VoterWeight is evaluated for

types.name: VoterWeightRecord
docs: Copied this struct from https://github.com/solana-labs/solana-program-library/blob/master/governance/addin-api/src/voter_weight.rs
Anchor has a macro (vote_weight_record) that is supposed to generate this struct, but it doesn't
work because the error's macros are not updated for anchor 0.22.0.
Even if it did work, the type wouldn't show up in the IDL. SPL doesn't produce an API, which
means that means we'd need the equivalent of this code on the client side.
If Anchor fixes the macro, we might consider changing it

fields.name: realm
docs: VoterWeightRecord discriminator sha256("account:VoterWeightRecord")[..8]
Note: The discriminator size must match the addin implementing program discriminator size
to ensure it's stored in the private space of the account data and it's unique
pub account_discriminator: [u8; 8],
The Realm the VoterWeightRecord belongs to

fields.name: governing_token_mint
docs: Governing Token Mint the VoterWeightRecord is associated with
Note: The addin can take deposits of any tokens and is not restricted to the community or
council tokens only

fields.name: governing_token_owner
docs: The owner of the governing token and voter
This is the actual owner (voter) and corresponds to TokenOwnerRecord.governing_token_owner

fields.name: voter_weight
docs: Voter's weight
The weight of the voter provided by the addin for the given realm, governing_token_mint and
governing_token_owner (voter)

fields.name: voter_weight_expiry
docs: The slot when the voting weight expires
It should be set to None if the weight never expires
If the voter weight decays with time, for example for time locked based weights, then the
expiry must be set As a common pattern Revise instruction to update the weight should
be invoked before governance instruction within the same transaction and the expiry set
to the current slot to provide up to date weight

fields.name: weight_action
docs: The governance action the voter's weight pertains to
It allows to provided voter's weight specific to the particular action the weight is
evaluated for When the action is provided then the governance program asserts the
executing action is the same as specified by the addin

fields.name: weight_action_target
docs: The target the voter's weight  action pertains to
It allows to provided voter's weight specific to the target the weight is evaluated for
For example when addin supplies weight to vote on a particular proposal then it must
specify the proposal as the action target When the target is provided then the
governance program asserts the target is the same as specified by the addin

fields.name: reserved
docs: Reserved space for future versions
